item.title: Day-14 (Looked into enabling emojis)
item.description: Wanted to use emojis and bit of a googling, and voila. ğŸ˜„ ğŸ‘ Turns out all you need to do is add this one property in config.toml enableEmoji = true And then I thought , well, lets try all of github supported emojis. Using the cheat sheet provided here gh-gist Not so sure how official this is. And now for funsies. item.title: Day-3 (Worked on making a hugo theme i18n)
item.description: Started working to create a new theme that is based off of hugo-multilingual-example but is more suitable for enterprise needs. This is not fully done yet.

item.title: Day-2 (Setting up CI for this journal)
item.description: Decided if I was going to use the journal blog, why fiddle around with source/master branch and manual pushes into master branch. Configured travis ci build script with personal access token and username to publish into master on successful builds.

item.title: Day-1 (Setting up this journal)
item.description: Started with 101daysofcode challenge. Decided on making a hugo based journal website. Found a decent theme for a journal blog, so forked it, will possibly be updating it in future. Day1’s work was to get a journal setup so its easy for me to track my progress. This journal is a hugo theme based website, the source code for which can be viewed 101daysofcode/hugo-journal
